problem_data.brief_description: Finding Largest Digit of a Number
problem_data.description:
Complete the program so that it reads a single integer input value, and prints a single line of output with the largest digit in the decimal representation of the input value.

For example, if the input value is 483, then the output should be 

8

because 8 is the largest digit in the decimal representation of 483.

Other examples:

Input Output
567912 9
2563 6
0 0

Hints:

  • Use a while loop. Think about how the loop can make progress and what the loop condition should be.
  • The loop should iterate through the digits of the input value.
  • If n is the input value, n%10 is the rightmost digit, and n/10 is an integer with all of the digits of n except for the rightmost digit
  • Think about what loop variables will be needed, and how they should be updated in the loop.
problem_data.author_name: Aarthy, AP / IT (improvements by David Hovemeyer)
